p: A focus of this work, both IFN signaling and IFN regulators, IRF/NFÎºB are known to be major components of the RSV-inducible genomic response. We and others have shown that RSV replication is a potent inducer of type I and III IFNs, proteins that play important roles in the local antiviral response, immune activation, and cell fate determination [ 3, 12, 47]. IFNs upregulate over 350 antiviral genes in adjacent non-infected cells; these proteins serve to induce resistance to viral replication, limiting the spread of virus [ 48].
